plot_matrix.py - plot a matrix (imshow)¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

Purpose¶

This script plots a matrix given in tabular format.

Usage¶

Example:

python plot_matrix.py --help

Type:

python plot_matrix.py --help

for command line help.

Command line options¶

Usage: plot_matrix.py [options]

Options:
  --version             show program's version number and exit
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --no-usage            output help without usage information
  -c COLUMNS, --columns=COLUMNS
                        columns to take from table.
  -a FILE, --hardcopy=FILE
                        write hardcopy to file.
  -f FILE, --file=FILE  filename with table data.
  -p PLOT, --plot=PLOT  plots to plot.
  -t THRESHOLD, --threshold=THRESHOLD
                        min threshold to use for counting method.
  -o COLOURS, --colours=COLOURS
                        column with colour information.
  -l LABELS, --labels=LABELS
                        column labels for x and y in matched plots.
  -e, --headers         headers are supplied in matrix.
  --no-headers          headers are not supplied in matrix.
  --normalize           normalize matrix.
  --palette=PALETTE     colour palette [default=%Default]
  --reverse-palette     reverse the palette [default=False].
  --xrange=XRANGE       xrange.
  --yrange=YRANGE       yrange.
  --zrange=ZRANGE       zrange.
  --xticks=XTICKS       xticks.
  --yticks=YTICKS       yticks.
  --bar-format=BAR_FORMAT
                        format for ticks on colourbar.
  --title=TITLE         title to use.
  --missing=MISSING     value to use for missing data.
  --subplots=SUBPLOTS   split matrix into several subplots. Supply number of
                        rows and columns separated by a comma.
  -v LOGLEVEL, --verbose=LOGLEVEL
                        loglevel [1]. The higher, the more output.
  --timeit=TIMEIT_FILE  store timeing information in file [none].
  --timeit-name=TIMEIT_NAME
                        name in timing file for this class of jobs [all].
  --timeit-header       add header for timing information [none].
  --random-seed=RANDOM_SEED
                        random seed to initialize number generator with
                        [none].
  -I FILE, --stdin=FILE
                        file to read stdin from [default = stdin].
  -L FILE, --log=FILE   file with logging information [default = stdout].
  -E FILE, --error=FILE
                        file with error information [default = stderr].
  -S FILE, --stdout=FILE
                        file where output is to go [default = stdout].
